Token.Abstract: The RKDynamicMappingMatcher class provides an interface for encapsulating the selection of an object mapping based on the runtime value of a property at a given key path. A matcher object is initialized with a key path, an expected value to be read from the key path, and an object mapping that is to be applied if the match evaluates to YES. When evaluating the match, the matcher invokes valueForKeyPath: on the object being matched and compares the value returned with the expectedValue via the RKObjectIsEqualToObject function.
Initializes the receiver with a given key path, expected value, and an object mapping that applies in the event of a positive match.

Parameter.Name: keyPath
Parameter.Abstract: The key path to obtain the comparison value from the object being matched via valueForKeyPath:.

Parameter.Name: expectedValue
Parameter.Abstract: The value that is expected to be read from keyPath if there is a match.

Parameter.Name: objectMapping
Parameter.Abstract: The object mapping object that applies if the comparison value is equal to the expected value.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The receiver, initialized with the given key path, expected value, and object mapping.

Token.Abstract: The key path to obtain the comparison value from the object being matched via valueForKeyPath:.
The key path to obtain the comparison value from the object being matched via valueForKeyPath:.
The value that is expected to be read from keyPath if there is a match.
The value that is expected to be read from keyPath if there is a match.
The object mapping object that applies if the comparison value read from keyPath is equal to the expectedValue.
The object mapping object that applies if the comparison value read from keyPath is equal to the expectedValue.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates if the given object matches the expectations of the receiver.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the object matches the expectations of the receiver, else NO.
